intro: Clarkia mildrediae subsp. lutescens, commonly known as the yellow Clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The subspecies is noted for its vibrant floral display and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
